Source code for managers_package.debug_manager

"""Debug manager."""

# -- Imports --

import inspect
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Any




[docs]
def get_caller_class():
    """Return the name of the class that called the debugger."""
    frame = inspect.currentframe().f_back.f_back  # type: ignore
    locals_ = frame.f_locals  # type: ignore

    if "self" in locals_:
        return locals_["self"].__class__.__name__

    if "cls" in locals_:
        return locals_["cls"].__name__

    return None






[docs]
class Debugger:
    """Debugger.

    ## Description
    Creates a text file in ~debug_output with the filename being the provided argument
    ## Attributes
    ```
    self.file_path = f"~debug_output/{file_name}.txt" # File path
    self.dud: bool # If debugger is not wanated set to true
    self.percist: bool # Set to true if you want logs to save after re-running (False by default)
    ```
    ## Methods
    ```
    write(self, message) # Writes a single line into the textfile created by the current object
    write_map(self, map: list[list[Any]]) # Writes an itterable into the text file
    ```
    """

    def __init__(self, file_name: str, percist=False, dud=False) -> None:
        """Initalise debugger."""
        self.file_path = f"~debug_output/{file_name}.txt"  # File path
        self.dud = dud  # If debugger is not wanated set to true
        self.percist = percist  # Set to true if you want logs to save after re-running (False by default)
        with open(self.file_path, "a" if self.percist else "w"):
            pass



[docs]
    def write(self, message):
        """Write a single line into the textfile created by the current object."""
        message = str(message)  # Strings the message
        with open(self.file_path, "a") as file:
            if not self.dud:
                file.write(
                    f'[{datetime.now().strftime("%H:%M:%S.%f")[:-3]}] [{get_caller_class()}] {message} \n'
                )
        file.close()





[docs]
    def write_map(self, map: list[list[Any]]):
        """Write a map row by row into the text file created by the current object (end of map is marked by '-----------')."""
        with open(self.file_path, "a") as file:
            for row in map:
                file.write(f'[{datetime.now().strftime("%H:%M:%S.%f")[:-3]}] {row} \n')
            file.write("----------- \n")
        file.close()
